file_content.text: I have hope that you will surprise us all, Sith, and prove to be better than your order.
Stop! Hold your weapon, Sith, I beg you!
Yul-li, stay your tongue.
No, she is just a Padawan, you are a great Master! I must bargain for your life.
Sith, I'll tell you everything I know, if you spare Master Yonlach.
Your devotion is remarkable.
So dedicated.
I'm sorry, Master Yonlach, but I must do this.
Hurry up.
Don't you want me to spare you, too?
How about you?
My life is less important. You may do with me as you please.
Her name is Jaesa Willsaam, and Nomen Karr has taken her to--
Master Karr took Jaesa from here, and he continues her training on--
Yul-li, you have no recollection of the Padawan this Sith seeks.
I have no recollection of the Padawan this Sith seeks.
Now, sleep.
I do not relish wiping Yul-li's mind like that. But his feelings for me got the better of him.
Most impressive.
Nice trick.
Don't apologize for doing what's necessary.
You did what you had to.
It's a terrible thing, a last resort. I had to act for the greater good.
Don't try that sorcerer's nonsense on me, Jedi.
I'm not so susceptible.
Believe me, I would, if I didn't sense it would be futile.
Jaesa is special, her power unprecedented. If untouched by the likes of you, she has the potential to lead the Jedi to greatness.
I'm going to do much more than touch her.
I won't let that happen.
You are filled with presumptions, Yonlach. I mean her no harm.
You've got me all wrong.
I know your kind, Sith. You twist the truth and manipulate weakness. I must err on the side of caution.
You've already failed, old man.
It's too late.
You know Jaesa's name, but that is all you'll get here. So, you may as well kill me.
All you know is Jaesa's name. You may as well kill me. You will learn nothing more here.
I must find tranquility, so Jaesa will sense only peace when you strike me down.
Your death will wound her deeply!
Not a chance! [Kill Yonlach]
I refuse to deal the killing blow. Just tell her I want to talk.
I do not seek your death.
You only wish to send a message? I am at a loss to understand you, Sith.
I'll grant you that allowance. Just tell me when you're ready.
Prepare yourself, Jedi.
You are a surprise, Sith. But if you think allowing me to find peace will make Jaesa susceptible to you, you are mistaken.
There is no death, there is the Force... I am ready now.
Be at peace, Master Jedi.
Rest now. [Kill Yonlach]
Thank... you....
Jaesa will join you in death soon enough.
More blood! [Kill Yonlach]
I changed my mind. I won't be the cause of your death, old man.
No, you will live.
I... I am beside myself. I've misjudged you. You only mean to send Jaesa a message.
Because of the link we share, Jaesa knows what transpired here. Your message has been received. She will do with it what she will.
That's all I ask. Goodbye, then.
I am pleased.
I leave you to wrestle with what you did to your fellow.
It's too bad about Yul-li.
I... do feel the shame of my actions. It will be difficult to live with.
Goodbye, Sith. You've left me with much to ponder.
I hope Jaesa is as gullible as you!
I lied! [Kill Yonlach]
There is no... death... only... the For... sss....
Well, the rumors are true--being paralyzed is a blast.
You put on quite a show. I knew you were good, but....
Hope you enjoyed yourself.
Have fun?
Not at all. It was infuriating not being able to wipe the sweat dripping from my nose.
Just another fight.
You're not fooling anyone. That was tough. I'm very impressed.
Were you hoping I would lose, Twi'lek?
Conflicted about the outcome?
Are you kidding, and be stuck on this overheated rock? I'd much rather be with you, believe me.
Would you have cried if I died, Vette?
Worried about me?
Of course I would have. You know you've become very special to me.
Sure. For many reasons. Mostly 'cause I'd be stuck on this overheated eyesore of a planet.
So. Sharack said she'd be at the ship. She thought we were done for. Can't wait to see the look on her face.
Her doubt was an insult.
The fool lacked faith.
She just didn't know any better. She will now, though.
She will be surprised to see us.
Her eyes will bug out.
I'll practice my smug look on the way there.
We don't return to her until I'm good and ready.
You'll have to wait.
Yeah, you're right, we should probably do some more sightseeing.
My lord, I'm sorry I was of no use to you. I did not anticipate the Jedi's incapacitating tactic.
Next time be more prepared, Captain.
Don't let it happen again.
I will endeavor to do so, my lord.
Don't be so hard on yourself, Quinn.
No worries.
I do not like to be caught unaware.
Get over it.
It's in the past.
I'm just thankful my support proved to be unnecessary.
Sharack said she would be at our ship. She thought we were doomed. We should inform her of our success.
She should never have doubted.
Her lack of faith insults me.
She's about to learn that, my lord.
She'll definitely be surprised.
Her eyes will bug out.
She should not have doubted you.
Not until I'm good and ready.
It will wait.
Not a minute sooner, my lord.
Master Yonlach, the Sith you've been tracking is upon us. Retreat to safety. I will take the intruder on!
No, Yul-li, control your feelings. Stand at my side. I will face this trespasser.
I've been watching you, Sith. In coming here, you have adulterated the journey of enlightenment and made a mockery of the Jedi way.
Come no farther, Sith. I have been aware of your pilgrimage here. You are a fascinating and contradictory example of your order.
I know why you've come. Master Nomen Karr's Padawan threatens you somehow. You seek to flush her into the open and silence her.
Good guess.
Yes. I seek Jaesa Willsaam.
That's right.
You're mistaken.
Don't insult me, child. You are an open book to me. You are here for her, I know it.
I'll see to it she never breathes another word.
Permanently.
I will not allow it. I won't be the cause of her exposure.
She came to me for guidance, and the bond we struck was the most profound of my life.
We are psychically linked, she and I, and I have already warned her about you. She will not fall for your manipulations.
I assure you, I can be very convincing.
You underestimate me.
Your will may be great, but hers is greater. And mine is unrelenting.
I only seek to talk to her.
I mean her no harm.
I will not fall for your manipulations either.
You do not face a mindless desert beast now, Sith. Nor defenseless, cowering Sand People.
You showed restraint and reason on your journey here. Your choices reflect conscientiousness I've never witnessed in a Sith.
The disparity in our capabilities is equal to the disparity in our age. You cannot win. Turn away now.
I've come too far to stop now.
I must see it through.
What does it matter how far you've come, if your life ends here?
I'm not afraid.
This is not an attempt at intimidation. Just a simple statement of fact.
I'll remain here until I kick sand on your corpse.
When you're dead.
Now it is clear to me you cannot be redeemed.
In me you face a full Jedi Master. And Yul-li has greater command of lightsaber combat than any Jedi Knight I've trained.
Uh, color me nervous. Have we ever faced a full-fledged card carrying Jedi Master before?
Just keep your mouth shut, Twi'lek.
Shut up.
Keep your wits, Vette.
Stay sharp.
The Jedi have no idea how lethal you are, Vette.
They're underestimating you.
I could take them even if you weren't here.
I won't even need your help.
My lord, the threat is not lost on me. Are you certain we can take on a full Jedi Master and a Jedi Knight?
Keep your wits, Quinn.
Stay sharp.
The Jedi have no idea how potent you are, Quinn.
They're underestimating you.
I sense that's a bluff. But no matter.
I could do it even if you weren't here, Captain.
I won't even need your help.
Interesting you should say that, Sith.
Your compatriot's query is moot, as you will be facing us on your own.
Well done, Master Yonlach. Now please, retreat and let me face the Sith.
Your concern is appreciated, Yul-li. But I did not seize the advantage here to immediately relinquish it.
You don't fight fair, Jedi.
That's dirty.
When the stakes are this high, I am bound to do whatever it takes to preserve the order.
Quinn only gets in my way.
I prefer it this way.
I sense his feelings for you, Sith. His devotion goes beyond professional duty.
Such misplaced affections are a sign of self-loathing, I think.
He sincerely admires you. It kills him that he must stand back and watch.
Such misplaced loyalty is a sign of deeply rooted issues.
Vette only gets in my way.
I prefer it this way.
She watches from her prison, part of her hoping that you are defeated.
If you attack us, Yul-li and I will accommodate that part of her.
I sense she is fond of you--despite herself. Bordering on masochism, I should think.
If you attack us, she will cry over your body. I hope that comforts you.
I tire of all this chatter. Time for you to die!
No more talk! [Attack]
Now, for the last time, will you stand down?
I don't respond well to threats.
You don't intimidate me.
Let me think about it.
Perhaps.
Enough of this! It's useless to reason with a Sith!
Yul-li, don't! Blazes, my hand is forced.
I'll be standing on your corpse soon enough!
Never! [Attack]
Your death will cry out to her!
We'll see about that. [Attack]
You've chosen to fight. You will do so without the aid of your Imperial!
You've chosen to fight. You will do so without the aid of your Twi'lek!
Fight with all you have, Yul-li. We must protect Jaesa!
Give no quarter, Yul-li. We fight to defend Nomen Karr's Padawan!
